84391.text: Change kube-proxy's default node IP back to 127.0.0.1, if this is incorrect, please use --bind-address to set the correct address
84391.markdown: Change kube-proxy's default node IP back to 127.0.0.1, if this is incorrect, please use --bind-address to set the correct address ([#84391](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/84391), [@zouyee](https://github.com/zouyee))
84391.author: zouyee

84917.markdown: fix race condition when attach/delete azure disk in same time ([#84917](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/84917), [@andyzhangx](https://github.com/andyzhangx))
84917.author: andyzhangx

85024.text: kubeadm: fix skipped etcd upgrade on secondary control-plane nodes when the command "kubeadm upgrade node" is used.
85024.markdown: kubeadm: fix skipped etcd upgrade on secondary control-plane nodes when the command "kubeadm upgrade node" is used. ([#85024](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/85024), [@neolit123](https://github.com/neolit123))
85024.author: neolit123

85096.text: In cases where the CoreDNS migration isn't supported and the user chooses to ignore the warnings from the preflight check, the migration will be skipped and the ConfigMap and Deployment of CoreDNS will be retained.
85096.markdown: In cases where the CoreDNS migration isn't supported and the user chooses to ignore the warnings from the preflight check, the migration will be skipped and the ConfigMap and Deployment of CoreDNS will be retained. ([#85096](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/85096), [@rajansandeep](https://github.com/rajansandeep))
85096.author: rajansandeep

85102.text: Change GCP ILB firewall names to contain the "k8s-fw-" prefix like the rest of the firewall rules. This is needed for consistency and also for other components to identify the firewall rule as k8s/service-controller managed.
85102.markdown: Change GCP ILB firewall names to contain the "k8s-fw-" prefix like the rest of the firewall rules. This is needed for consistency and also for other components to identify the firewall rule as k8s/service-controller managed. ([#85102](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/85102), [@prameshj](https://github.com/prameshj))
85102.author: prameshj

85115.text: azure: update disk lock logic per vm during attach/detach to allow concurrent updates for different nodes.
85115.markdown: azure: update disk lock logic per vm during attach/detach to allow concurrent updates for different nodes. ([#85115](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/85115), [@aramase](https://github.com/aramase))
85115.author: aramase

85385.text: For x-kubernetes-list-type=set a scalar or atomic item type is now required, as documented. Persisted, invalid data is tolerated.

85462.markdown: Fixes a performance issue when using server-side apply with objects with very large atomic maps. ([#85462](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/85462), [@jennybuckley](https://github.com/jennybuckley))
